title: Should you donate your DNA to help cure diseases? - Greg Foot

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why developing new drugs for currently untreatable diseases is a slow process?

options.label: B
options.text: A way to collect genetic data and health history data from individuals

options.label: C
options.text: A way to design new drugs

options.label: D
options.text: A way to test new drugs

options.label: B

options.label: C

multiple-choice.question: What are the three options researchers have once they have identified a new therapeutic target?

options.label: A
options.text: 1) Use a drug that has already been developed for a different disease, 2) use a drug that has shown promise but ultimately didn't work for a different disease, or 3) design a new drug to target the faulty protein

options.label: B
options.text: 1) Use a drug that has already been developed for a different disease, 2) use a drug that has shown promise but ultimately didn't work for a different disease, or 3) use a genetic test to diagnose the disease

options.label: C
options.text: 1) Use a drug that has already been developed for a different disease, 2) use a drug that has shown promise but ultimately didn't work for a different disease, or 3) use a different approach to develop a new drug

options.label: D
options.text: 1) Use a drug that has already been developed for a different disease, 2) use a drug that has shown promise but ultimately didn't work for a different disease, or 3) use a different genetic test to diagnose the disease

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential benefit of identifying a new therapeutic target?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: It may lead to a better understanding of the causes of the disease

options.label: C
options.text: It may lead to the identification of a new genetic test for the disease

options.label: D
options.text: It may lead to the development of a new treatment for a different disease

options.label: B
options.text: It is used to identify new therapeutic targets

options.label: C
options.text: It is used to test new drugs

options.label: D

options.label: C
options.text: It may lead to the identification of new genetic tests for diseases

options.label: D
options.text: It may lead to more personalized treatment for patients

options.label: D

options.text: They should not donate their data for research

options.label: B

options.label: C

title: How compassion could save your strained relationships - Betty Hart

multiple-choice.question: What is cancel culture?

options.label: A
options.text: A movement to promote social justice and equality

options.label: B
options.text: A way to ostracize or make someone persona non grata due to a disagreement or differing opinion

options.label: C
options.text: A method of resolving conflicts through mediation

options.label: D
options.text: A way to promote understanding and empathy

multiple-choice.question: What is compassion culture?

options.label: A
options.text: A way to promote social justice and equality

options.label: B
options.text: A way to ostracize or make someone persona non grata due to a disagreement or differing opinion

options.label: C
options.text: A way to choose to suffer alongside someone rather than canceling them

options.label: D
options.text: A method of resolving conflicts through mediation

multiple-choice.question: Why does Betty believe that cancel culture needs to change?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it is not effective in resolving conflicts

options.label: B
options.text: Because it often assumes that one person is right and the other is wrong

options.label: C
options.text: Because it can lead to hurt feelings and damaged relationships

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a situation where compassion culture was used?

options.label: A
options.text: The example of Ruth Bader Ginsburg and Antonin Scalia

options.label: B
options.text: The example of Betty and her father

options.label: C
options.text: The example of a couple who divorced due to irreconcilable differences

options.label: D
options.text: The example of a company that fired an employee due to a disagreement

multiple-choice.question: What does Betty encourage us to do instead of canceling people?

options.label: B
options.text: To try to change their minds

options.label: C
options.text: To choose compassion and suffer alongside them

multiple-choice.question: What is the benefit of choosing compassion over canceling?

options.label: A
options.text: It leads to more conflict and hurt feelings

options.label: B
options.text: It allows us to value the totality of the person rather than just one particular aspect

options.label: C
options.text: It leads to a deeper understanding of the other person's perspective

options.label: D
options.text: It leads to a stronger sense of self-righteousness

multiple-choice.question: Why does Betty believe that we should plant seeds of change, influence, and diversity?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it will lead to more conflict and hurt feelings

options.label: B
options.text: Because it will lead to a deeper understanding of the other person's perspective

options.label: C
options.text: Because it will allow us to grow and learn from others

options.label: D
options.text: Because it will lead to a stronger sense of self-righteousness

multiple-choice.question: What is an example of a personal experience that Betty shares to illustrate the importance of compassion?

options.label: A
options.text: The example of Ruth Bader Ginsburg and Antonin Scalia

options.label: B
options.text: The example of Betty and her father reconnecting after 10 years of not speaking

options.label: C
options.text: The example of a couple who divorced due to irreconcilable differences

options.label: D
options.text: The example of a company that fired an employee due to a disagreement

multiple-choice.question: What does Betty encourage us to become as a society?

options.label: A
options.text: A society that chooses canceling over compassion

options.label: B
options.text: A society that chooses compassion over canceling

options.label: C
options.text: A society that is more divided and fragmented

options.label: D
options.text: A society that is more homogeneous and less diverse

multiple-choice.question: What is the final message that Betty wants to convey to her audience?

options.label: A
options.text: That we should give up on trying to understand and empathize with others

options.label: B
options.text: That we should continue to cancel and ostracize those who disagree with us

options.label: C
options.text: That we should choose compassion and plant seeds of change, influence, and diversity

options.label: D
options.text: That we should ignore those who disagree with us and focus on our own self-interest
